messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] quoting/forwarding posts
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/14/02 9:01:05 AM, starsuncloud@cs.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/14/02 9:01:05 AM, starsuncloud@... writes:

<< I don't know if you would ever need any of mine, but it's always ok with
me.
Anything I put online is ok to use. If I don't want it used, I wouldn't post
it here! >>

But Ren, you're smarter than some people who seem not even to want their
public posts quoted back to them later the same day!!!

Sandra

messages.subject: quoting/forwarding posts
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/14/02 5:22:52 AM Central Standard Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:  I don t know if you would ever
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/14/02 5:22:52 AM Central Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Would that be okay? >>

I don't know if you would ever need any of mine, but it's always ok with me.
Anything I put online is ok to use. If I don't want it used, I wouldn't post
it here!

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] quoting/forwarding posts
messages.msgSnippet: I don t mind being quoted, but hope that if you see a punctuation or spelling error, you fix it. Sometimes when I m posting, I don t proof read very well!
messages.messageBody:
I don't mind being quoted, but hope that if you see a punctuation or spelling error, you fix it. Sometimes when I'm posting, I don't proof read very well! Also, if this is going on a website, I'd love the url!
Thanks!
Warmly,
Robin
"What we learn with pleasure we never forget."
Alfred Mercier


----- Original Message -----
From: cris trainor
To: alwayslearningpost
Sent: Friday, December 13, 2002 12:49 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] quoting/forwarding posts



Hey Everyone!

I'm wondering if anyone minds if I quote and forward some things from this list to my homeschool group's info list? I'm particularly thinking of Robin's rant about homemaking etc., and all the great responses esp. in digest # 653. It's a huge issue for many of us in the group right now and I know people would be thrilled to know they're sure not alone!

Also I'm in the process of putting together my personal/business web page and would like to post some quotes from some of you on my unschooling page, mostly philosophical type stuff, nothing personal. I could/would give credit or use things anonymously. Would that be okay?

Thanks so much for putting yourselves "out there" where we all can find you.

crisrobin (long-time lurker and alwayslearner!)Get more from the Web. FREE MSN Explorer download : http://explorer.msn.com


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] quoting/forwarding posts
messages.msgSnippet: You can quote anything of mine, anytime. Probably you should ask individuals.  Some people might want to polish or revise before making something more
messages.messageBody:
You can quote anything of mine, anytime.

Probably you should ask individuals. Some people might want to polish or
revise before making something more permanent. Or they might not want their
kids names out there that way. (I know this list is "out there," but it's
harder to find than a webpage, in some ways. The archives are anyway.)

Sandra
